description: The Ouachita Mountain leadplant, also known as Amorpha ouachitensis, is an amazing species due to its beauty and hardiness. This native shrub is drought tolerant and grows in full sun to partial shade, blooming with beautiful purple flowers throughout the summer. It has an upright growing habit and pruned at any time of year to maintain an even shape. The flowers attract butterflies and the small leaves act as a lovely backdrop. Its hardiness makes it the perfect species for beginners and those wanting to add some unique and easy-to-maintain native plants to their garden.
